title: Ep 22: What’s Wrong with Being Average and How to Change It.
description:
Are you living an extraordinary life, or have you settled for a rather typical and average one? Being average only restricts your limitless potential. Quitting being ordinary, on the other hand, might help you figure out how to make the most of your life and become truly exceptional.

In this episode of The Tactical Entrepreneur podcast, Steve shares some useful tips to help you soar above mediocrity in your professional and personal life. To thrive, whether, in the firearms business or any other industry, you must break free from the status quo and create something resourceful to stand out from the crowd. “I'd encourage you to conduct a serious evaluation of where you are, then look for those gaps in where the industry is and see if there's anything that can be influenced for development," your host advises. Listen in to know more because today, Steve presents another motivational podcast to keep you from giving up on the ‘unstoppable you.’



What You Will Learn:

 

  • What innovations in the gun store can help you take your business to the next level.
  • Why you must look at things from the consumer's viewpoint if you want to succeed in business.
  • How crucial it is to discern yourself in any field you work in, and how to get started.
  • Why you should never refrain from putting your thoughts into action and how the most bizarre idea might turn out to be the greatest one.

 

  • And much more!

 

Favorite Quote:

“Innovation creates gaps in the industry, gaps create opportunities for you, opportunities create growth, and growth brings change.”

   - Steve Schabacker

 

How To Get Involved:

Steve Schabacker is the co-founder of Sheepdog Firearms and an entrepreneur, bestselling author, and marketer. Between his business and his content, Steve is educating firearm owners and armed professionals and setting a new standard for shops and training centers in the industry.

You can visit Sheepdog Firearms online or reach out directly to Steve at sschabacker@outlook.com.

Check out this podcast on Apple Podcasts - don’t forget to subscribe, rate, and review!
